properties.name: otel.attribute.count.limit
properties.description: The maximum number of attributes. Applies to spans, span events, span links, and logs.

properties.name: otel.attribute.value.length.limit
properties.description: The maximum length of attribute values. Applies to spans and logs. By default, there is no limit.

properties.name: otel.blrp.export.timeout
properties.description:
The maximum allowed time, in milliseconds, to export OTLP log batch data.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.blrp.max.export.batch.size
properties.description: The maximum OTLP log batch size.

properties.name: otel.blrp.max.queue.size
properties.description: The maximum OTLP log batch queue size.

properties.name: otel.blrp.schedule.delay
properties.description:
The interval, in milliseconds, between two consecutive OTLP log batch exports.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.bsp.schedule.delay
properties.description:
The interval, in milliseconds, between two consecutive OTLP span batch exports.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.bsp.export.timeout
properties.description:
The maximum allowed time, in milliseconds, to export OTLP span batch data.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.bsp.max.export.batch.size
properties.description: The maximum OTLP span batch size.

properties.name: otel.bsp.max.queue.size
properties.description: The maximum OTLP span batch queue size.

properties.name: otel.experimental.exporter.otlp.retry.enabled
properties.description: Enable experimental retry support. See https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/main/sdk-extensions/autoconfigure/README.md#otlp-exporter-retry.

properties.name: otel.experimental.metrics.cardinality.limit
properties.description: If set, configure experimental cardinality limit. The value dictates the maximum number of distinct points per metric.

properties.name: otel.experimental.metrics.view.config
properties.description: View file configuration See https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/main/sdk-extensions/incubator/README.md#view-file-configuration.

properties.name: otel.experimental.resource.disabled.keys
properties.description: Filter out resource entries with these keys.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP trace, metric, or log server's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default the host platform's trusted root certificates are used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.client.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP trace, metric, or log client's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default, no chain file is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.client.key
properties.description:
The path to the file containing private client key to use when verifying an OTLP trace, metric, or log client's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one private key PKCS8 PEM format.
By default, no client key is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.compression
properties.description:
The compression type to use on OTLP trace, metric, and log requests.
Options include gzip.
By default, no compression will be used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.endpoint
properties.description:
The OTLP traces, metrics, and logs endpoint to connect to.
Must be a URL with a scheme of either http or https based on the use of TLS. If protocol is http/protobuf the version and signal will be appended to the path (e.g. v1/traces, v1/metrics, or v1/logs).
Default is http://localhost:4317 when protocol is grpc, and http://localhost:4318/v1/{signal} when protocol is http/protobuf.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.headers
properties.description:
Request headers for OTLP trace, metric, and log requests.
Can be either a Spring map or a key-value separated String, e.g. key1=value1,key2=value2.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP log server's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default, the host platform's trusted root certificates are used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.client.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP log server's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default, no chain file is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.client.key
properties.description:
The path to the file containing private client key to use when verifying an OTLP log client's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one private key PKCS8 PEM format.
By default, no client key file is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.compression
properties.description:
The compression type to use on OTLP log requests.
Options include gzip.
By default, no compression will be used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.endpoint
properties.description:
The OTLP logs endpoint to connect to.
Must be a URL with a scheme of either http or https based on the use of TLS.
Default is http://localhost:4317 when protocol is grpc, and http://localhost:4318/v1/logs when protocol is http/protobuf.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.headers
properties.description:
Request headers for OTLP log requests.
Can be either a Spring map or a key-value separated String, e.g. key1=value1,key2=value2.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.protocol
properties.description: The transport protocol to use on OTLP log requests.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.logs.timeout
properties.description:
The maximum waiting time, in milliseconds, allowed to send each OTLP log batch.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP metric server's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default, the host platform's trusted root certificates are used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.client.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP metric server's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default, no chain file is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.client.key
properties.description:
The path to the file containing private client key to use when verifying an OTLP metric client's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one private key PKCS8 PEM format.
By default, no client key file is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.compression
properties.description:
The compression type to use on OTLP metric requests.
Options include gzip.
By default, no compression will be used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.default.histogram.aggregation
properties.description: The preferred default histogram aggregation.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.endpoint
properties.description:
The OTLP metrics endpoint to connect to.
Must be a URL with a scheme of either http or https based on the use of TLS.
Default is http://localhost:4317 when protocol is grpc, and http://localhost:4318/v1/metrics when protocol is http/protobuf.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.headers
properties.description:
Request headers for OTLP metric requests.
Can be either a Spring map or a key-value separated String, e.g. key1=value1,key2=value2.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.protocol
properties.description: The transport protocol to use on OTLP metric requests.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.temporality.preference
properties.description: The preferred output aggregation temporality.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.timeout
properties.description:
The maximum waiting time, in milliseconds, allowed to send each OTLP metric batch.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.protocol
properties.description: The transport protocol to use on OTLP trace, metric, and log requests.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.timeout
properties.description:
The maximum waiting time, in milliseconds, allowed to send each OTLP trace, metric, and log batch.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP trace server's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default, the host platform's trusted root certificates are used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.client.certificate
properties.description:
The path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP trace server's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one or more X.509 certificates in PEM format.
By default no chain file is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.client.key
properties.description:
The path to the file containing private client key to use when verifying an OTLP trace client's TLS credentials.
The file should contain one private key PKCS8 PEM format.
By default, no client key file is used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.compression
properties.description:
The compression type to use on OTLP trace requests.
Options include gzip.
By default, no compression will be used.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.endpoint
properties.description:
The OTLP traces endpoint to connect to.
Must be a URL with a scheme of either http or https based on the use of TLS.
Default is http://localhost:4317 when protocol is grpc, and http://localhost:4318/v1/traces when protocol is http/protobuf.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.headers
properties.description:
Request headers for OTLP trace requests.
Can be either a Spring map or a key-value separated String, e.g. key1=value1,key2=value2.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.protocol
properties.description: The transport protocol to use on OTLP trace requests.

properties.name: otel.exporter.otlp.traces.timeout
properties.description:
The maximum waiting time, in milliseconds, allowed to send each OTLP trace batch.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.exporter.zipkin.endpoint
properties.description:
The Zipkin endpoint to connect to.
Currently only HTTP is supported.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.annotations.enabled
properties.description: Enable the @WithSpan annotation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.common.db-statement-sanitizer.enabled
properties.description: Enables the DB statement sanitization.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.common.default-enabled
properties.description: Enables all instrumentations. Set to false to disable all instrumentations and then enable specific modules individually, e.g. otel.instrumentation.jdbc.enabled=true.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.common.peer-service-mapping
properties.description: Used to specify a mapping from host names or IP addresses to peer services, as a comma-separated list of host_or_ip=user_assigned_name pairs. The peer service is added as an attribute to a span whose host or IP address match the mapping. See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/zero-code/java/agent/configuration/#peer-service-name.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.http.client.capture-request-headers
properties.description: List of HTTP request headers to capture in HTTP clients.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.http.client.capture-response-headers
properties.description: List of HTTP response headers to capture in HTTP clients.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.http.client.emit-experimental-telemetry
properties.description: Enable the capture of experimental HTTP client telemetry. Add the http.request.body.size and http.response.body.size> attributes to spans, and record the http.client.request.size and http.client.response.size metrics.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.http.known-methods
properties.description: Configures the instrumentation to recognize an alternative set of HTTP request methods. All other methods will be treated as _OTHER.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.http.server.capture-request-headers
properties.description: List of HTTP request headers to capture in HTTP servers.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.http.server.capture-response-headers
properties.description: List of HTTP response headers to capture in HTTP servers.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.http.server.emit-experimental-telemetry
properties.description: Enable the capture of experimental HTTP server telemetry. Add the http.request.body.size and http.response.body.size attributes to spans, and record the http.server.request.body.size and http.server.response.body.size metrics.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.jdbc.enabled
properties.description: Enable the JDBC instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.jdbc.statement-sanitizer.enabled
properties.description: Enables the DB statement sanitization.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.kafka.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Kafka instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.kafka.experimental-span-attributes
properties.description: Enable the capture of experimental Kafka span attributes.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.kafka.autoconfigure-interceptor
properties.description: Enable automatic configuration of tracing interceptors on ConcurrentKafkaListenerContainerFactory using a BeanPostProcessor. You may disable this if you wish to manually configure these interceptors.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.mongo.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Mongo client instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.mongo.statement-sanitizer.enabled
properties.description: Enables the DB statement sanitization.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.log4j-appender.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Log4J2 appender instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Logback appender instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.experimental.capture-code-attributes
properties.description: Enable the capture of source code attributes. Note that capturing source code attributes at logging sites might add a performance overhead.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.experimental.capture-marker-attribute
properties.description: Enable the capture of Logback markers as attributes.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.experimental.capture-key-value-pair-attributes
properties.description: Enable the capture of Logback key value pairs as attributes.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.experimental-log-attributes
properties.description: Enable the capture of experimental log attributes thread.name and thread.id.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.experimental.capture-logger-context-attributes
properties.description: Enable the capture of Logback logger context properties as attributes.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.experimental.capture-logstash-attributes
properties.description: Enable the capture of Logstash attributes, supported are those added to logs via `Markers.append()`, `Markers.appendEntries()`, `Markers.appendArray()` and `Markers.appendRaw()` methods.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-appender.experimental.capture-mdc-attributes
properties.description: MDC attributes to capture. Use the wildcard character * to capture all attributes. This is a comma-separated list of attribute names.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-mdc.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Logback MDC instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.logback-mdc.add-baggage
properties.description: Enable exposing baggage attributes through MDC.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.common.logging.trace-id
properties.description: Customize MDC key name for the trace id.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.common.logging.span-id
properties.description: Customize MDC key name for the span id.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.common.logging.trace-flags
properties.description: Customize MDC key name for the trace flags.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.micrometer.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Micrometer instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.r2dbc.enabled
properties.description: Enable the R2DBC (reactive JDBC) instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.r2dbc.statement-sanitizer.enabled
properties.description: Enables the DB statement sanitization.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.runtime-telemetry.enabled
properties.description: Enable runtime telemetry metrics.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.runtime-telemetry.emit-experimental-telemetry
properties.description: Enable the capture of experimental metrics.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.runtime-telemetry-java17.enable-all
properties.description: Enable the capture of all JFR based metrics.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.runtime-telemetry-java17.enabled
properties.description: Enable the capture of JFR based metrics.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.spring-web.enabled
properties.description: Enable the RestTemplate instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.spring-webflux.enabled
properties.description: Enable the WebClient instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.spring-webmvc.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Servlet instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.instrumentation.spring-scheduling.enabled
properties.description: Enable the Spring Scheduling instrumentation.

properties.name: otel.java.enabled.resource.providers
properties.description: Enables one or more ResourceProvider types. If unset, all resource providers are enabled. Each entry is the fully qualified classname of a ResourceProvider.

properties.name: otel.java.disabled.resource.providers
properties.description: Disables one or more ResourceProvider types. Each entry is the fully qualified classname of a ResourceProvider.

properties.name: otel.logs.exporter
properties.description: List of exporters to be used for logs.

properties.name: otel.metric.export.interval
properties.description:
The interval, in milliseconds, between the start of two export attempts.
Durations can be of the form {number}{unit}, where unit is one of:
  • ms
  • s
  • m
  • h
  • d

If no unit is specified, milliseconds is the assumed duration unit.

properties.name: otel.metrics.exemplar.filter
properties.description: The filter for exemplar sampling.

properties.name: otel.metrics.exporter
properties.description: List of exporters to be used for metrics.

properties.name: otel.propagators
properties.description: List of propagators to be used for context propagation.

properties.name: otel.resource.attributes
properties.description: Resource attributes to be added to all spans. In addition to these attributes, the resource will also include attributes discovered from the runtime, such as host.name and process.id.

properties.name: otel.sdk.disabled
properties.description: Disable the OpenTelemetry Spring Starter.

properties.name: otel.service.name
properties.description: Specify logical service name. Takes precedence over service.name defined with otel.resource.attributes.

properties.name: otel.span.attribute.value.length.limit
properties.description: The maximum length of span attribute values. Takes precedence over otel.attribute.value.length.limit. By default, there is no limit.

properties.name: otel.span.attribute.count.limit
properties.description: The maximum number of attributes per span. Takes precedence over <code>otel.attribute.count.limit<code>.

properties.name: otel.span.event.count.limit
properties.description: The maximum number of events per span.

properties.name: otel.span.link.count.limit
properties.description: The maximum number of links per span.

properties.name: otel.traces.exporter
properties.description: List of exporters to be used for tracing.

properties.name: otel.traces.sampler
properties.description: The sampler to use for tracing.

properties.name: otel.traces.sampler.arg
properties.description: An argument to the configured tracer if supported, for example a ratio.

values.description: All instruments will have cumulative temporality.
Counter (sync and async) and histograms will be delta, up down counters (sync and async) will be cumulative.
Sync counter and histograms will be delta, async counter and up down counters (sync and async) will be cumulative.
The console exporter prints exported logs to stdout. It's mainly used for testing and debugging.
No autoconfigured exporter.
OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) exporter.
Take all exemplars.
Drop all exemplars.
Choose exemplars that correspond to a sampled span.
The console exporter prints exported metrics to stdout. It's mainly used for testing and debugging.
No autoconfigured exporter.
OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) exporter.
The Baggage propagator propagates baggage using the W3C Baggage format. See https://www.w3.org/TR/baggage/.
The B3 propagator propagates trace context using the B3 single-header format: See https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation#single-header.
The B3 propagator propagates trace context using the B3 multi-header format: See https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation#multiple-headers.
The Jaeger propagator propagates trace context using the Jaeger format. See https://www.jaegertracing.io/docs/1.21/client-libraries/#propagation-format.
The OpenTelemetry Trace Context propagator propagates trace context using the OpenTelemetry format. See https://github.com/opentracing/specification/blob/master/rfc/trace_identifiers.md.
The Trace Context propagator propagates trace context using the W3C Trace Context format (add `baggage` as well to include W3C baggage). See https://www.w3.org/TR/trace-context/.
The AWS X-Ray propagator propagates trace context using the AWS X-Ray format. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/xray/latest/devguide/xray-concepts.html#xray-concepts-tracingheader.
The console exporter prints the name of the span along with its attributes to stdout. It's mainly used for testing and debugging.
No autoconfigured exporter.
OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) exporter.
Zipkin exporter.
Keep all spans.
Drop all spans.
Keep a ratio of <code>otel.traces.sampler.arg<code> of all spans.
Keep all spans where the parent is also kept. If there is no parent, keep all spans.
Keep all spans where the parent is also kept. If there is no parent, drop all spans.
Keep all spans where the parent is also kept. If there is no parent, keep a ratio of <code>otel.traces.sampler.arg<code> of all spans.
